bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 1 (Tuesday, January 3, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]Mr. BURGESS:H.R. 117.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This legislation would repeal existing federal law, whichwas passed under the claimed constitutional authority ofArticle I, Section 8, Clause 3, often referred to as the``Commerce Clause.''[Page H49]

item.name: Energy, Climate and Grid Security Subcommittee
Energy, Climate and Grid Security Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text:
Energy Efficiency Free Market Act of 2016

This bill amends the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to eliminate the Department of Energy's authority to set energy efficiency and water conservation standards for consumer and commercial appliances. All existing standards are repealed.

Additionally, the bill prohibitsstatesfrom setting their own energy efficiency and water conservation standards.All existing state standards are nullified.

bill.title: Energy Efficiency Free Market Act of 2017

item.title: Energy Efficiency Free Market Act of 2017
To repeal Federal energy conservation standards, and for other purposes.
Energy Efficiency Free Market Act of 2017

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
